payload.content: Claude Code is the highest leverage skill you can learn this year.

name: Claude Code is the highest leverage skill you can learn this year.
content: Claude Code is the highest leverage skill you can learn this year.

payload.content: The future of design is here.

name: The future of design is here.
content: The future of design is here.

payload.content: A designer, not a developer, built a personal website with an AI chat and a growth design tool in 48 hours using Claude Code, demonstrating the tool's ability to enable rapid product deployment for non-developers.

name: A designer, not a developer, built a personal website with an AI chat and a grow
content: A designer, not a developer, built a personal website with an AI chat and a growth design tool in 48 hours using Claude Code, demonstrating the tool's ability to enable rapid product deployment for non-developers.

payload.content: Claude Code is a coding agent that writes code based on plain English instructions.

name: Claude Code is a coding agent that writes code based on plain English instructio
content: Claude Code is a coding agent that writes code based on plain English instructions.

payload.content: When using Claude Code, understanding what you're building is more important than understanding syntax.

name: When using Claude Code, understanding what you're building is more important tha
content: When using Claude Code, understanding what you're building is more important than understanding syntax.

payload.content: Claude Code is considered better than Cursor or other similar tools as of today.

name: Claude Code is considered better than Cursor or other similar tools as of today.
content: Claude Code is considered better than Cursor or other similar tools as of today.

payload.content: A Tetris game was built using only Figma MCP connected to FigJam and then to Claude Code, without any manual design or coding.

name: A Tetris game was built using only Figma MCP connected to FigJam and then to Cla
content: A Tetris game was built using only Figma MCP connected to FigJam and then to Claude Code, without any manual design or coding.

payload.content: An internal growth design tool with a database, user authentication, and AI-powered recommendations was built and deployed live on the internet in 3 days, attracting over 500 users.

name: An internal growth design tool with a database, user authentication, and AI-powe
content: An internal growth design tool with a database, user authentication, and AI-powered recommendations was built and deployed live on the internet in 3 days, attracting over 500 users.

payload.content: Install Claude Code on Mac by running `npm install -g @anthropic-ai/claude-code` in Terminal, ensuring Node.js is installed first if npm is unavailable.

name: Install Claude Code on Mac by running `npm install -g @anthropic-ai/claude-code`
content: Install Claude Code on Mac by running `npm install -g @anthropic-ai/claude-code` in Terminal, ensuring Node.js is installed first if npm is unavailable.

payload.content: Verify Claude Code installation by typing `claude` in the terminal; it should launch a text interface.

name: Verify Claude Code installation by typing `claude` in the terminal; it should la
content: Verify Claude Code installation by typing `claude` in the terminal; it should launch a text interface.

payload.content: Alternatively, download the Claude Code desktop Mac app, which requires an Anthropic account.

name: Alternatively, download the Claude Code desktop Mac app, which requires an Anthr
content: Alternatively, download the Claude Code desktop Mac app, which requires an Anthropic account.

payload.content: Basic terminal commands for Claude Code include `claude` (start), `cd folder-name` (navigate in), `cd ..` (navigate out), `ls` (list files Mac), `dir` (list files Windows), and `pwd` (show current location Mac).

name: Basic terminal commands for Claude Code include `claude` (start), `cd folder-nam
content: Basic terminal commands for Claude Code include `claude` (start), `cd folder-name` (navigate in), `cd ..` (navigate out), `ls` (list files Mac), `dir` (list files Windows), and `pwd` (show current location Mac).

payload.content: To start a new project with Claude Code, create a directory using `mkdir my-portfolio`, navigate into it with `cd my-portfolio`, and then launch Claude Code with `claude`.

name: To start a new project with Claude Code, create a directory using `mkdir my-port
content: To start a new project with Claude Code, create a directory using `mkdir my-portfolio`, navigate into it with `cd my-portfolio`, and then launch Claude Code with `claude`.

payload.content: Always start a Claude Code project by asking for a plan, specifying requirements and desired outputs like tech stack, file structure, design considerations, and a step-by-step implementation plan in a `plan.md` file.

name: Always start a Claude Code project by asking for a plan, specifying requirements
content: Always start a Claude Code project by asking for a plan, specifying requirements and desired outputs like tech stack, file structure, design considerations, and a step-by-step implementation plan in a `plan.md` file.

payload.content: Adjust the project plan generated by Claude Code by providing specific instructions, such as changing the tech stack to vanilla HTML/CSS instead of React.

name: Adjust the project plan generated by Claude Code by providing specific instructi
content: Adjust the project plan generated by Claude Code by providing specific instructions, such as changing the tech stack to vanilla HTML/CSS instead of React.

payload.content: Implement a project in Claude Code by instructing it to follow the `plan.md`, starting with HTML structure and then adding CSS styling.

name: Implement a project in Claude Code by instructing it to follow the `plan.md`, st
content: Implement a project in Claude Code by instructing it to follow the `plan.md`, starting with HTML structure and then adding CSS styling.

payload.content: Preview a local Claude Code project in a browser by running `npx serve` and opening `http://localhost:3000`.

name: Preview a local Claude Code project in a browser by running `npx serve` and open
content: Preview a local Claude Code project in a browser by running `npx serve` and opening `http://localhost:3000`.

payload.content: Iterate on Claude Code projects by providing specific styling, responsiveness, and functionality prompts, such as making a hero section full-height, adding padding, creating hover effects, changing fonts, implementing responsive layouts, adding smooth scrolling, or integrating contact forms.

name: Iterate on Claude Code projects by providing specific styling, responsiveness, a
content: Iterate on Claude Code projects by providing specific styling, responsiveness, and functionality prompts, such as making a hero section full-height, adding padding, creating hover effects, changing fonts, implementing responsive layouts, adding smooth scrolling, or integrating contact forms.

payload.content: Commit Claude Code projects to GitHub by initializing git and connecting to a repository using either a direct Claude Code instruction or manual commands: `git init`, `git remote add origin <repo_url>`, `git add .`, `git commit -m "Initial commit"`, and `git push -u origin main`.

name: Commit Claude Code projects to GitHub by initializing git and connecting to a re
content: Commit Claude Code projects to GitHub by initializing git and connecting to a repository using either a direct Claude Code instruction or manual commands: `git init`, `git remote add origin <repo_url>`, `git add .`, `git commit -m "Initial commit"`, and `git push -u origin main`.

payload.content: Create documentation for a Claude Code project by instructing it to generate a `README.md` explaining the project and how to run it locally, and a `claude.md` describing the architecture and context for future sessions.

name: Create documentation for a Claude Code project by instructing it to generate a `
content: Create documentation for a Claude Code project by instructing it to generate a `README.md` explaining the project and how to run it locally, and a `claude.md` describing the architecture and context for future sessions.

payload.content: Deploy a Claude Code project to Vercel either through the Vercel dashboard by importing the GitHub repository or by instructing Claude Code directly to deploy.

name: Deploy a Claude Code project to Vercel either through the Vercel dashboard by im
content: Deploy a Claude Code project to Vercel either through the Vercel dashboard by importing the GitHub repository or by instructing Claude Code directly to deploy.

payload.content: To deploy a project to Vercel via the dashboard: click Add New → Project, import your GitHub repository, then click Deploy.

name: To deploy a project to Vercel via the dashboard: click Add New → Project, import
content: To deploy a project to Vercel via the dashboard: click Add New → Project, import your GitHub repository, then click Deploy.

payload.content: Once deployed to Vercel, every future push to GitHub will automatically trigger a new deployment.

name: Once deployed to Vercel, every future push to GitHub will automatically trigger
content: Once deployed to Vercel, every future push to GitHub will automatically trigger a new deployment.

payload.content: Add a custom domain to a Vercel-deployed project by going to Settings > Domains in Vercel, adding the domain, and then updating DNS records at the domain provider with the provided A and CNAME records.

name: Add a custom domain to a Vercel-deployed project by going to Settings > Domains
content: Add a custom domain to a Vercel-deployed project by going to Settings > Domains in Vercel, adding the domain, and then updating DNS records at the domain provider with the provided A and CNAME records.

payload.content: To add a custom domain in Vercel: go to Settings → Domains, add your domain (e.g., yourname.com), and then update DNS records at your domain provider with the provided A and CNAME records.

name: To add a custom domain in Vercel: go to Settings → Domains, add your domain (e.g
content: To add a custom domain in Vercel: go to Settings → Domains, add your domain (e.g., yourname.com), and then update DNS records at your domain provider with the provided A and CNAME records.

payload.content: When expanding a static site into a web app with features like Google sign-in, an AI chat widget, and a comment section, research the best approach and create an implementation-plan.md covering services needed (auth, database, AI), architecture overview, security considerations, and step-by-step implementation phases.

name: When expanding a static site into a web app with features like Google sign-in, a
content: When expanding a static site into a web app with features like Google sign-in, an AI chat widget, and a comment section, research the best approach and create an implementation-plan.md covering services needed (auth, database, AI), architecture overview, security considerations, and step-by-step implementation phases.

payload.content: Create a .env file for storing API keys (e.g., SUPABASE_URL, SUPABASE_ANON_KEY, OPENAI_API_KEY) and ensure it is excluded from GitHub using a .gitignore file to prevent committing sensitive information.

name: Create a .env file for storing API keys (e.g., SUPABASE_URL, SUPABASE_ANON_KEY,
content: Create a .env file for storing API keys (e.g., SUPABASE_URL, SUPABASE_ANON_KEY, OPENAI_API_KEY) and ensure it is excluded from GitHub using a .gitignore file to prevent committing sensitive information.

payload.content: To set up Supabase for a new project: create a project on supabase.com, then copy the Project URL and anon key from Settings → API.

name: To set up Supabase for a new project: create a project on supabase.com, then cop
content: To set up Supabase for a new project: create a project on supabase.com, then copy the Project URL and anon key from Settings → API.

payload.content: To enable Google sign-in with Supabase: enable Google as a provider in Supabase (Authentication → Providers), then create an OAuth Client ID in Google Cloud Console (APIs & Services → Credentials) and copy the Client ID back to Supabase.

name: To enable Google sign-in with Supabase: enable Google as a provider in Supabase
content: To enable Google sign-in with Supabase: enable Google as a provider in Supabase (Authentication → Providers), then create an OAuth Client ID in Google Cloud Console (APIs & Services → Credentials) and copy the Client ID back to Supabase.

payload.content: To securely store an OpenAI API key for server-side use, add it as a secret in Supabase Edge Functions (Settings → Edge Functions → Add Secret) with a name like OPENAI_API_KEY and its corresponding value, ensuring it is never exposed to users.

name: To securely store an OpenAI API key for server-side use, add it as a secret in S
content: To securely store an OpenAI API key for server-side use, add it as a secret in Supabase Edge Functions (Settings → Edge Functions → Add Secret) with a name like OPENAI_API_KEY and its corresponding value, ensuring it is never exposed to users.

payload.content: When implementing a web app with Supabase for auth/database and OpenAI for chat, prioritize authentication, then add the AI chat feature, and finally the comment system, using Google sign-in only.

name: When implementing a web app with Supabase for auth/database and OpenAI for chat,
content: When implementing a web app with Supabase for auth/database and OpenAI for chat, prioritize authentication, then add the AI chat feature, and finally the comment system, using Google sign-in only.

payload.content: A planning prompt for AI involves asking it to research how to build a specific component and create a plan.md with tech stack, structure, and implementation steps.

name: A planning prompt for AI involves asking it to research how to build a specific
content: A planning prompt for AI involves asking it to research how to build a specific component and create a plan.md with tech stack, structure, and implementation steps.

payload.content: An implementation prompt for AI involves instructing it to implement a project according to a plan.md, specifying a starting component.

name: An implementation prompt for AI involves instructing it to implement a project a
content: An implementation prompt for AI involves instructing it to implement a project according to a plan.md, specifying a starting component.

payload.content: A prompt for adding features to a project involves specifying the feature, its desired behavior, and any necessary services or APIs.

name: A prompt for adding features to a project involves specifying the feature, its d
content: A prompt for adding features to a project involves specifying the feature, its desired behavior, and any necessary services or APIs.

payload.content: A debugging prompt for AI involves providing an error message (optionally with a screenshot) and asking the AI to find and fix the issue.

name: A debugging prompt for AI involves providing an error message (optionally with a
content: A debugging prompt for AI involves providing an error message (optionally with a screenshot) and asking the AI to find and fix the issue.

payload.content: The Vibe-Coding course includes installation walkthroughs (Mac + Windows), interface orientation, a first project tutorial, GitHub + version control, Vercel deployment, custom domains, Supabase + OpenAI integration, and bonus chapters on AI agents and Figma MCP.

name: The Vibe-Coding course includes installation walkthroughs (Mac + Windows), inter
content: The Vibe-Coding course includes installation walkthroughs (Mac + Windows), interface orientation, a first project tutorial, GitHub + version control, Vercel deployment, custom domains, Supabase + OpenAI integration, and bonus chapters on AI agents and Figma MCP.

payload.content: Designers should learn to build, as it empowers them to bring their ideas to reality without relying on others.

name: Designers should learn to build, as it empowers them to bring their ideas to rea
content: Designers should learn to build, as it empowers them to bring their ideas to reality without relying on others.
